hotspots.hotspot: One isotope, known as copper-63, accounts for 69.17% of all naturally occurring copper atoms. The second isotope, known as copper-65, accounts for 30.83% of all naturally occurring copper atoms.

multiple.question: Methane (CH<sub>4</sub>) has 0 carbon atoms and 4 hydrogen atoms.

scene.credits: (tr)Lauren Burke/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images, (bkgd)Image Source/Getty Images.

multiple.question: Water (H<sub>2</sub>O) has one hydrogen atom and two oxygen atoms.

scene.credits: (tr)Lauren Burke/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images, (bkgd)Image Source/Getty Images.

multiple.question: Glucose (C<sub>6</sub>H<sub>12</sub>O<sub>6</sub>) has six carbon atoms, twelve hydrogen atoms, and six oxygen atoms.

scene.credits: (tr)Lauren Burke/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images, (bkgd)Image Source/Getty Images.

content.instruction:
Covalent bond – a bond formed when atoms share one or more pairs of electrons

If you have trouble viewing this animation, you may need to download Real Player®.

scene.credits: (tr)Lauren Burke/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images, (bkgd)Image Source/Getty Images.

content.instruction:
Ionic bonds – electrons are transferred to form a cation and an anion that attract one another

Cation – an ion that has a positive charge

Anion – an ion that has a negative charge

If you have trouble viewing this animation, you may need to download Real Player®.

multiple.question: An element is a substance that contains only one kind of atom.
The periodic table arranges elements according to their atomic mass.
The atomic number of an element tells how many electrons are in an atom of that element.
Molybdenum is an element that conducts electricity, so it is a nonmetal.
The elements oxygen and hydrogen that make up the compound water are chemically combined.
A molecule of the compound calcium chloride (CaCl<sub>2</sub>) has two atoms of chlorine.
Valence electrons are the electrons that usually bond to form an octet.
Atoms in ionic compounds are transferred from one atom to another.
Prefixes are used when naming ionic compounds.
Dinitrogen monoxide is a compound that is made up of one nitrogen atom and one oxygen atom.
